body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governer of Kentucky

The Petition of the undersigned would respectfully -- represent that in April last he had an altercation with one Robert Garry -- in which angry -- words were used -- Whereupon -- the Said Garry Struck Petitioner twice with a heavy hickory kane -- and this before any ^still^ demonstration was made by Petitioner -- After -- w which Petitioner -- endeavored to Avenge the blows -- when mutual friends interfered -- and Petitioner did not lay his hand upon Garry by reason of the interferance Garry and Petitioner were tried for a breach of the peace before E. Lusly a Justice of the Peace of Owen -- and a Jury impanneled who rendered a verdict fining both Garry & Petitioner $9.25 & costs Judgment was rendered on the verdict -- execution issued and is now in the hands of -- P. H. Smith marshall of the Town of Owenton -- Your Petitioner prays -- Executive Clemency and that said fine be remitted & as in duty bound &c
I was present at the trial of J. J. Green & Robert Garry on a warrant for breach of the Peace --
I heard all the proof on the trial -- and the facts -- as I understand them -- as on were in Substance as stated in the within Petition

Owen J. P.
Petition to Governor
$925 } Misdemeanor
J. J. Green
